availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Gentry (Webster Co., KY, JP & Farmer)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. North Carolina native. Married to Martha Gentry. Father of James A. Gentry, Moses J. Gentry, William H. Gentry, Yancey W. Gentry, Elean Gentry, Albert J. Gentry, and John W. Gentry. Farmer in Person County, North Carolina, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Farmer in Webster County in 1863. Master freemason at Carlow Lodge No. 314 in Webster County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Person County, p. 475A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 138.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Webster County, KY, June 1863, p. 8.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, (Frankfort, KY: Frankfort Commonwealth, Printer, 1867), 323.
"William W. Gentry (1818-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #74824870, accessed August 18, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74824870.
